name: Martina Zähle
content:
Martina Zähle (born 1950)[1] is a German mathematician specializing in geometric measure theory and stochastic geometry. She is a professor of mathematics at the University of Jena, where she holds the chair for geometry.[2]
 Zähle completed her doctorate in 1978 at the University of Jena. Her dissertation, Ergodizitätseigenschaften von Strömungsmodellen mit Anwendungen in der Bedienungstheorie, was supervised by Joseph Mecke.[3] She earned a habilitation at Jena in 1982.[4]
 She is the coauthor of the book Curvature Measures of Singular Sets (with Jan Rataj, Springer, 2019).[5]
 
 This article about a German mathematician is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
raw:
German mathematician

Martina Zähle (born 1950)[1] is a German mathematician specializing in geometric measure theory and stochastic geometry. She is a professor of mathematics at the University of Jena, where she holds the chair for geometry.[2]
Zähle completed her doctorate in 1978 at the University of Jena. Her dissertation, Ergodizitätseigenschaften von Strömungsmodellen mit Anwendungen in der Bedienungstheorie, was supervised by Joseph Mecke.[3] She earned a habilitation at Jena in 1982.[4]
She is the coauthor of the book Curvature Measures of Singular Sets (with Jan Rataj, Springer, 2019).[5]
